thread.title: Rutgers BOG athletics committee discussed "some personnel issues"
thread.title_full: Rutgers BOG athletics committee discussed "some personnel issues"

title: Rutgers BOG athletics committee discussed "some personnel issues"
text:
Rutgers BOG athletics committee discussed "some personnel issues" Ryan Dunleavy , @rydunleavy 7:03 p.m. EDT October 14, 2015 Greg Brown, left, chairman of the Rutgers University board of governors, and Rutgers president Robert Barchi share a laugh before a public meeting in June. (Photo: AP) 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW BRUNSWICK The Rutgers Board of Governors committee on intercollegiate athletics concluded its private meeting Wednesday morning by breaking into executive session to discuss “some personnel issues,” according to committee chairperson Ken Schmidt. 
No further detail on those personnel matters was disclosed publicly Wednesday when Schmidt debriefed other members of the Board of Governors at a regularly scheduled Wednesday afternoon meeting in Winants Hall. 
Rutgers football coach Kyle Flood’s school-issued three-game suspension and accompanying four-week media ban for impermissible contact with a faculty member ended last weekend. He apologized Monday to the entire Rutgers community , ahead of Saturday’s game at Indiana. 
The school has hired outside counsel to put together a report investigating whether the football program committed any NCAA violations. 
Rutgers declined a request to make Board of Governors chairperson Greg Brown and Rutgers president Robert Barchi available for interview. Brown seldom grants media interviews, while Barchi more commonly answers questions after board meetings. Kyle Flood knows 'What have you done for me lately' nature of coaching 
Rutgers academic oversight chair Carl Kirschner presented the athletics committee a review of the academic performance of student-athletes through cumulative and academic year GPAs from 2005 through 2015 and APR scores, according to Schmidt. 
Athletics director Julie Hermann, associate athletic director in charge of fundraising Sarah Baumgartner, chief marketing officer Geoff Brown and chief financial officer Janine Purcaro also met with the committee. 
Rutgers athletics fundraising through the first quarter of the fiscal year is up by about 17 percent over last year, according to Schmidt. 
The Rutgers-Ohio State football game at 8 p.m. Oct. 24 at High Point Solutions Stadium is a sellout, Schmidt said. 
Hermann updated the committee on “where athletics is as it relates to pending facilities in the overall physical master plan” and progress made in Title IX compliance, Schmidt said. 
Purcaro provided an update on the outlook for the fiscal year budget, including the impact cost-of-attendance stipends will have on the budget going forward, according to Schmidt. 
Staff Writer Ryan Dunleavy: rdunleavy@gannettnj.com 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.app.com/1RIPJ4P TOP VIDEOS
